skillTree.localised_description: "It's a rabbit's foot. A rabbit. Noâ€¦ Oh never mind - it brings me luck. It does! Trust me!"
You'd better kill this one or they'll keep coming back until one of you is dead. Even then, there's no guarantee it'll be over!
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: The dead reach out from the rotten corpse of Navrre with grasping hands and broken teeth to fasten themselves on any living creature they can, dragging those unfortunate souls into the great mass of Navrre's body.

Howls and haunting moans spring forth from the corpse trapped within Infanta Leanora Navrre's corrupted form, the screams of her victims once more given voice. Sadly for those despoiled within, their cries do nothing more than wound those who can hear them.

target_if: Leadership is lower than 50% of base

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: The vengeful Navarre, after being outcast and hunted by the nobles of Estalia for her terrible crimes, dared to bind herself within a Necrofex Colossus and has ravaged her erstwhile domains for more than a century like a Daemon from the night.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: -80 with all Southern Realms

Income from raiding: +100%
	(all units in army)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +100%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: While the Darkness' Daughter might be the Necrofex within which Navrre has bound herself, it is by no means the only one that she has created. Those other, lesser, constructs that follow her are bolstered by her mere presence.

skillTree.localised_description: The humans who in Navrre's mind abused her are the main target of her aggression, and she will always bend her efforts towards seeing them beaten and broken upon the wheel of fate. Preferably by her own actions.

skillTree.localised_description: Necrofex Colossi like Infanta Leanora Navrre are loci of magic, drawing in the dark and violent tendencies of magic and rejecting those of light and life. Any caster who attempts to use those winds in the presence of Darkness' Daughter will find themselves hamstrung.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic cost: -20% for Lore of the Deeps, Vampires, and Death spells
	(all characters in region)

Winds of Magic cost: +20% for Lore of Life and Light spells
	(all characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: "Yes, theyâ€™re from the east. Annoying, yet useful - their hides, particularlyâ€¦"
If there's swash to be buckled, this one will be right at the front, in the thick of the fray.
Strike hard, strike true.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
There is something to be said for whipping the foe into a frenzy before the fight is joined.
"Dark Magic might be effective, but there's no substitute for a good blade in your hands."
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The strength and agility of the Vampire comes from a place beyond: the supernatural realm of the Unliving.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
You have to watch this one - when you shake their hand, count your fingers afterwards.
Sheer, undiluted spite sharpens the dead eye further.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Spiteful Shot"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spiteful Shot Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Spiteful Shot Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: No matter how far away, none can escape the Kiss of the Deep, nor breathe again with lungs full of seawater.
The tidal currents shall slow the foe's advance.

A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
They could not break free, even if they wanted to.
Cursed to haunt the waves forever, never finding rest or solace.
If it's not tacked down, this one'll 'ave it and kill anyone who gets in their way.

skillTree.localised_description: Such things keep the eternal players' of this world alive.
Take care of your ship and she will have a care for your wellbeing in return.
Beware those who sail under the black flag - they give no quarter and never, ever give up the chase.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: -40 with all Southern Realms
Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Necrofex Colossus units (minimum 1)
Passive ability: "Regeneration" when fighting at sea
Immune to High Seas, Reef and Storm attrition

items.colour_text: Forged from ancient bronze, the Figurehead stands as a grotesque fusion of maritime iconography and eldritch horror. The face of the Figurehead is a visage of perpetual agony, frozen in a rictus of despair. Hollow sockets bore into the souls of onlookers, devoid of eyes yet emanating a malevolent presence that seems to pierce through the veil of mortal existence. A palpable aura of darkness envelops the Figurehead, casting a pall of despair over all who dare to gaze upon it. Its very presence seems to drain the warmth from the air, leaving behind a suffocating chill that freezes the hearts of even the bravest souls. Those who behold it speak of an overwhelming sense of hopelessness and dread, as if the Figurehead itself is a harbinger of the world's impending doom.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -6
	(enemy armies in local region)

items.colour_text:
Forged from the darkest obsidian and infused with the malevolent energies of the Strigoi, each blade bears intricate runes etched along its razor-sharp edge. These runes, imbued with ancient vampiric magic, writhe and pulse with unholy power, whispering promises of dominance and destruction to their wielder.
	
	The Blades of the Fallen Empire are a matching pair, perfectly balanced and honed to perfection. Their jet-black blades gleam with a sinister sheen, reflecting the light like shards of midnight. Despite their age, they remain as sharp as the day they were forged, capable of slicing through armor and bone with ease.
	
	As symbols of the lost Strigos Empire, the Blades of the Fallen Empire serve as a reminder of a time when vampires ruled the land with an iron fist. To those who dare oppose Vorag Bloodytooth and his dark ambitions, they are harbingers of doom, heralding the return of a long-forgotten reign of terror.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Darkness' Daughter, a towering behemoth of terror and destruction, is the fearsome embodiment of Infanta Leanora Navarre's bound fury and boundless vengeance. This colossal construct strikes fear into the hearts of all who witness its inexorable advance. Clad in the accursed metal of ancient dreadnoughts, the Darkness' Daughter rises from the depths like a nightmare given form. Its massive frame, towering over even the mightiest ships of war, is adorned with the remnants of its grisly conquests â€” the shattered hulls and broken bodies of those who dared to oppose it. Upon its skeletal prow, the Figurehead of Desolation looms, a grotesque visage of terror that casts a shadow of despair across the seas. As it marches ever onward, the Darkness' Daughter leaves behind a trail of devastation and despair, its passage marked by the smoldering ruins of cities and the anguished cries of the innocent. None can stand against its inexorable advance, for it is not merely a machine of war, but a living embodiment of the darkness that lurks within the hearts of all.

effects.description: Legendary Ships: If Infanta Leanora Navrre hunts down and kills special enemy ships, she receives extra bonuses.
